intro: Scurrula chingii, commonly known as the Chinese scurrula, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
